field.name: summary
field.value: DataBinder.InternalRecursiveBindObjectInstance checks validation errors for every property that may break SameAsValidator and NotSameAsValidator

field.name: description
field.value: Current implementation of InternalRecursiveBindObjectInstance() calls CheckForValidationFailures() for every property. This may lead to incorrect behavior of SameAsValidator, NotSameAsValidator and every other validator that depends on several property values. Actually these validators become dependent of GetProperties() result array order. And this order cannot be controlled in .net at all, especially when using inheritance or partial classes. It seems that InternalRecursiveBindObjectInstance() must validate object instance, not every property - it's the only way to fix this bug.

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: This issue is also reported in http://support.castleproject.org/projects/MR/issues/view/MR-ISSUE-516

comment.text: Checking validation errors against instance, rather than one property at a time.
